hackathon-description-text: On April 22nd, two-hundred students from across the region will come together for 24 hours of creation, innovation and fun! Anyone is welcome to join, from seasoned coding veterans to first-time hackers from any major or field. Discover how you can create change by developing technology to solve real world problems, get mentored by industry professionals, and enjoy tons of free food, swag and awesome prizes!
hackathon-eligibility: All Students 18 and older can participate.  You must be physically at the event in order to submit and be judged.
hackathon-rules:
Max Team Size of 4
All self work must be done at the Hackathon.
 
We follow the MLH code of conduct, which can be found here
https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 Cash Money for best overall hack!  Money is divided evenly through team members.
One Google Home for per team member (up to 4).
Domain.com Swag Bags for each team member.
The Best Use of Amazon Web Services will receive $250 in AWS credit.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: UE ROLL 2 Waterproof Volcano Wireless Portable Bluetooth Speaker for each team member (up to 4).
Each team member gets a Raspberry Pi Starter Kit (up to 4).
25 Dollar Amazon Gift Cards for each team member for the best use of any API (up to 4).
Amazon Fire TV Sticks for the best hardware hack (up to 4).

For the best use of REAL Biomimicry on a biomimicry challenge or on another HAkron challenge. (Don't feel confident enough to try these challenges? You deifnitely can! Look for Stephanie or any other biomimicry mentor to ask for ideas and help! Also check out these great resources:
Best uses of REAL Biomimicry on any biomimicry challenge.
Best uses of REAL Biomimicry on any biomimicry challenge.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=526 S Main St #511, Akron, OH 44311, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
The top 5 teams overall will be found using MIT Gavel.  Check out 
 for information on how Gavel works.
The top 5 teams will give a short presentation to everyone, where they will be judged again to determine the Grand Prize winner and Runner Up.
Best API, Best Hardware Hack, etc. will be judged by selected judges and the winner will be based on technical difficulty, completeness, design, and presentation.

hackathon-location-address: 526 S Main St #511, Akron, OH 44311, USA
hackathon-description-header: The University of Akron's 2017 Hackathon at The Bit Factory!
